alert.note: Alert for Blount; Knox; Loudon; Roane; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 5:38AM CDT until August 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN BLOUNT, CENTRAL KNOX, CENTRAL LOUDON, SOUTHEASTERN ROANE AND WEST CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTIES... At 638 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding has been reported in many locations with numerous roads closed or impassible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Maryville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Loudon, Farragut, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Halls, Friendsville, Philadelphia, Clover Hill, Wildwood, Lake Forest, Powell, Walland, Seymour, Tellico Village and Kimberlin Heights. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
